Description: A circular terracotta clay oil lamp with large circular hole in centre for oil. Small protruding nozzle. No handle wheel-made Classical lamp. Virtually no moulding. Red-brown Nile silt fabric with red core with common fine quartz, mica, organic vesicles and white inclusions.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by City Art Gallery and Museum, Bristol. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Unprovenanced parallel from Egypt, dated from the 6th to 5th century BC or ' considerably later' (Bailey 1975, British Museum Lamps I, Q514).
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (KC.29) (Phase 1)
